import unittest
from unittest.mock import MagicMock, patch
from pathlib import Path
import os

# Import the function - adjust the module as needed
from module import adjust_directory_perms_recursively

class TestAdjustDirectoryPermsRecursively(unittest.TestCase):

    def test_single_owned_change(self):
        # Test single directory owned by user, permissions need change
        current_uid = 1000
        current_mode = 0o700
        new_perms = 0o755
        
        target_dir = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        target_dir.stat.return_value.st_uid = current_uid
        target_dir.stat.return_value.st_mode = current_mode
        target_dir.parent = target_dir  # Stop recursion
        
        with patch('os.getuid', return_value=current_uid):
            adjust_directory_perms_recursively(target_dir, new_perms)
            
        target_dir.chmod.assert_called_once_with(new_perms)

    def test_single_owned_no_change_needed(self):
        # Test single directory owned by user, permissions already set
        current_uid = 1000
        current_mode = 0o755
        new_perms = 0o755
        
        target_dir = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        target_dir.stat.return_value.st_uid = current_uid
        target_dir.stat.return_value.st_mode = current_mode
        target_dir.parent = target_dir
        
        with patch('os.getuid', return_value=current_uid):
            adjust_directory_perms_recursively(target_dir, new_perms)
            
        target_dir.chmod.assert_not_called()

    def test_single_not_owned(self):
        # Test single directory not owned by user
        current_uid = 1000
        other_uid = 1001
        current_mode = 0o700
        new_perms = 0o755
        
        target_dir = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        target_dir.stat.return_value.st_uid = other_uid
        target_dir.stat.return_value.st_mode = current_mode
        target_dir.parent = target_dir
        
        with patch('os.getuid', return_value=current_uid):
            adjust_directory_perms_recursively(target_dir, new_perms)
            
        target_dir.chmod.assert_not_called()

    def test_chain_two_owned(self):
        # Test two directories: child and parent owned, both need change
        current_uid = 1000
        current_mode = 0o700
        new_perms = 0o755
        
        root_dir = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        root_dir.stat.return_value.st_uid = current_uid
        root_dir.stat.return_value.st_mode = current_mode
        root_dir.parent = root_dir  # Stop recursion
        
        parent_dir = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        parent_dir.stat.return_value.st_uid = current_uid
        parent_dir.stat.return_value.st_mode = current_mode
        parent_dir.parent = root_dir
        
        child_dir = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        child_dir.stat.return_value.st_uid = current_uid
        child_dir.stat.return_value.st_mode = current_mode
        child_dir.parent = parent_dir
        
        with patch('os.getuid', return_value=current_uid):
            adjust_directory_perms_recursively(child_dir, new_perms)
            
        child_dir.chmod.assert_called_once_with(new_perms)
        parent_dir.chmod.assert_called_once_with(new_perms)
        root_dir.chmod.assert_called_once_with(new_perms)

    def test_chain_child_owned_parent_not_owned(self):
        # Test child owned (changed), parent not owned (skipped)
        current_uid = 1000
        other_uid = 1001
        current_mode = 0o700
        new_perms = 0o755
        
        parent_dir = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        parent_dir.stat.return_value.st_uid = other_uid
        parent_dir.stat.return_value.st_mode = current_mode
        parent_dir.parent = parent_dir  # Stop recursion
        
        child_dir = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        child_dir.stat.return_value.st_uid = current_uid
        child_dir.stat.return_value.st_mode = current_mode
        child_dir.parent = parent_dir
        
        with patch('os.getuid', return_value=current_uid):
            adjust_directory_perms_recursively(child_dir, new_perms)
            
        child_dir.chmod.assert_called_once_with(new_perms)
        parent_dir.chmod.assert_not_called()

    def test_chain_child_owned_parent_error(self):
        # Test child changed successfully, parent raises PermissionError
        current_uid = 1000
        current_mode = 0o700
        new_perms = 0o755
        
        parent_dir = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        parent_dir.stat.return_value.st_uid = current_uid
        parent_dir.stat.return_value.st_mode = current_mode
        parent_dir.parent = parent_dir  # Stop recursion
        parent_dir.chmod.side_effect = PermissionError("Permission denied")
        
        child_dir = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        child_dir.stat.return_value.st_uid = current_uid
        child_dir.stat.return_value.st_mode = current_mode
        child_dir.parent = parent_dir
        
        with patch('os.getuid', return_value=current_uid), \
             patch('builtins.print') as mock_print:
            adjust_directory_perms_recursively(child_dir, new_perms)
            
        child_dir.chmod.assert_called_once_with(new_perms)
        parent_dir.chmod.assert_called_once_with(new_perms)
        self.assertEqual(mock_print.call_count, 1)
        printed_message = mock_print.call_args[0][0]
        self.assertIn("Failed to change", printed_message)
        self.assertIn("Permission denied", printed_message)

    def test_root_owned(self):
        # Test root directory owned and changed
        current_uid = 1000
        current_mode = 0o700
        new_perms = 0o755
        
        root_dir = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        root_dir.stat.return_value.st_uid = current_uid
        root_dir.stat.return_value.st_mode = current_mode
        root_dir.parent = root_dir  # Stop recursion
        
        with patch('os.getuid', return_value=current_uid):
            adjust_directory_perms_recursively(root_dir, new_perms)
            
        root_dir.chmod.assert_called_once_with(new_perms)

    def test_chain_child_not_owned_parent_owned(self):
        # Test child not owned (skipped), parent owned (changed)
        current_uid = 1000
        other_uid = 1001
        current_mode = 0o700
        new_perms = 0o755
        
        parent_dir = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        parent_dir.stat.return_value.st_uid = current_uid
        parent_dir.stat.return_value.st_mode = current_mode
        parent_dir.parent = parent_dir  # Stop recursion
        
        child_dir = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        child_dir.stat.return_value.st_uid = other_uid
        child_dir.stat.return_value.st_mode = current_mode
        child_dir.parent = parent_dir
        
        with patch('os.getuid', return_value=current_uid):
            adjust_directory_perms_recursively(child_dir, new_perms)
            
        child_dir.chmod.assert_not_called()
        parent_dir.chmod.assert_called_once_with(new_perms)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    unittest.main()

import unittest
from unittest.mock import patch, Mock
from pathlib import Path
import os

class TestModifyDirPerms(unittest.TestCase):
    @patch('os.getuid')
    def test_owned_directory_and_parent(self, mock_getuid):
        """Test directories owned by user are updated, stopping at non-owned parent."""
        current_uid = 1000
        mock_getuid.return_value = current_uid
        
        root = Mock(spec=Path)
        root.parent = root
        root.stat.return_value.st_uid = 0
        root.stat.return_value.st_mode = 0o755
        
        dir0 = Mock(spec=Path)
        dir0.parent = root
        dir0.stat.return_value.st_uid = current_uid
        dir0.stat.return_value.st_mode = 0o755
        
        target_dir = Mock(spec=Path)
        target_dir.parent = dir0
        target_dir.stat.return_value.st_uid = current_uid
        target_dir.stat.return_value.st_mode = 0o755
        
        modify_dir_perms(target_dir, 0o700)
        
        target_dir.chmod.assert_called_once_with(0o700)
        dir0.chmod.assert_called_once_with(0o700)
        root.chmod.assert_not_called()

    @patch('os.getuid')
    def test_not_owned_directory(self, mock_getuid):
        """Test non-owned directory results in no changes and no recursion."""
        current_uid = 1000
        mock_getuid.return_value = current_uid
        
        target_dir = Mock(spec=Path)
        target_dir.parent = target_dir
        target_dir.stat.return_value.st_uid = 0
        target_dir.stat.return_value.st_mode = 0o755
        
        modify_dir_perms(target_dir, 0o700)
        
        target_dir.chmod.assert_not_called()

    @patch('os.getuid')
    @patch('builtins.print')
    def test_permission_error_handling(self, mock_print, mock_getuid):
        """Test PermissionError during chmod is caught and printed, stopping recursion."""
        current_uid = 1000
        mock_getuid.return_value = current_uid
        
        parent_dir = Mock(spec=Path)
        parent_dir.stat.return_value.st_uid = current_uid
        
        target_dir = Mock(spec=Path)
        target_dir.parent = parent_dir
        target_dir.stat.return_value.st_uid = current_uid
        target_dir.stat.return_value.st_mode = 0o755
        target_dir.chmod.side_effect = PermissionError("Operation not permitted")
        
        modify_dir_perms(target_dir, 0o700)
        
        target_dir.chmod.assert_called_once_with(0o700)
        mock_print.assert_called_once()
        self.assertIn("Failed to change", mock_print.call_args[0][0])
        parent_dir.chmod.assert_not_called()

    @patch('os.getuid')
    def test_root_directory_stops_recursion(self, mock_getuid):
        """Test root directory changes permissions and stops recursion due to parent being self."""
        current_uid = 1000
        mock_getuid.return_value = current_uid
        
        root = Mock(spec=Path)
        root.parent = root
        root.stat.return_value.st_uid = current_uid
        root.stat.return_value.st_mode = 0o755
        
        modify_dir_perms(root, 0o700)
        
        root.chmod.assert_called_once_with(0o700)

    @patch('os.getuid')
    def test_already_correct_permissions(self, mock_getuid):
        """Test directory with correct permissions skips chmod but processes parent."""
        current_uid = 1000
        mock_getuid.return_value = current_uid
        
        parent_dir = Mock(spec=Path)
        parent_dir.stat.return_value.st_uid = current_uid
        parent_dir.stat.return_value.st_mode = 0o755
        
        target_dir = Mock(spec=Path)
        target_dir.parent = parent_dir
        target_dir.stat.return_value.st_uid = current_uid
        target_dir.stat.return_value.st_mode = 0o700
        
        modify_dir_perms(target_dir, 0o700)
        
        target_dir.chmod.assert_not_called()
        parent_dir.chmod.assert_called_once_with(0o700)

    @patch('os.getuid')
    def test_intermediate_directory_not_owned(self, mock_getuid):
        """Test recursion stops at first non-owned parent in hierarchy."""
        current_uid = 1000
        mock_getuid.return_value = current_uid
        
        grandparent = Mock(spec=Path)
        grandparent.stat.return_value.st_uid = current_uid
        
        parent_dir = Mock(spec=Path)
        parent_dir.parent = grandparent
        parent_dir.stat.return_value.st_uid = 0
        
        target_dir = Mock(spec=Path)
        target_dir.parent = parent_dir
        target_dir.stat.return_value.st_uid = current_uid
        target_dir.stat.return_value.st_mode = 0o755
        
        modify_dir_perms(target_dir, 0o700)
        
        target_dir.chmod.assert_called_once_with(0o700)
        parent_dir.chmod.assert_not_called()
        grandparent.chmod.assert_not_called()

if __name__ == '__main__':
    unittest.main()

import unittest
from unittest.mock import patch, MagicMock, PropertyMock
import os
from pathlib import Path
from solution import update_dir_permissions_recursive

class TestUpdateDirPermissionsRecursive(unittest.TestCase):

    @patch('os.getuid')
    def test_single_directory_owned_permission_change(self, mock_getuid):
        # Test single directory owned by user with different permissions: should change
        mock_getuid.return_value = 1000
        mock_dir = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        type(mock_dir).parent = PropertyMock(return_value=mock_dir)
        mock_stat = mock_dir.stat.return_value
        mock_stat.st_uid = 1000
        mock_stat.st_mode = 0o700
        
        update_dir_permissions_recursive(mock_dir, 0o755)
        
        mock_dir.chmod.assert_called_once_with(0o755)

    @patch('os.getuid')
    def test_single_directory_owned_no_permission_change(self, mock_getuid):
        # Test single directory owned by user with same permissions: no change
        mock_getuid.return_value = 1000
        mock_dir = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        type(mock_dir).parent = PropertyMock(return_value=mock_dir)
        mock_stat = mock_dir.stat.return_value
        mock_stat.st_uid = 1000
        mock_stat.st_mode = 0o755
        
        update_dir_permissions_recursive(mock_dir, 0o755)
        
        mock_dir.chmod.assert_not_called()

    @patch('os.getuid')
    def test_two_directories_both_owned_both_changed(self, mock_getuid):
        # Test two directories (child and parent), both owned and both needing permission change
        mock_getuid.return_value = 1000
        mock_child = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        mock_parent = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        type(mock_child).parent = PropertyMock(return_value=mock_parent)
        type(mock_parent).parent = PropertyMock(return_value=mock_parent)
        
        mock_child_stat = mock_child.stat.return_value
        mock_child_stat.st_uid = 1000
        mock_child_stat.st_mode = 0o700
        mock_parent_stat = mock_parent.stat.return_value
        mock_parent_stat.st_uid = 1000
        mock_parent_stat.st_mode = 0o700
        
        update_dir_permissions_recursive(mock_child, 0o755)
        
        mock_child.chmod.assert_called_once_with(0o755)
        mock_parent.chmod.assert_called_once_with(0o755)

    @patch('os.getuid')
    def test_two_directories_child_owned_parent_not_owned(self, mock_getuid):
        # Test child owned (changed) and parent not owned: only child changes
        mock_getuid.return_value = 1000
        mock_child = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        mock_parent = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        type(mock_child).parent = PropertyMock(return_value=mock_parent)
        type(mock_parent).parent = PropertyMock(return_value=mock_parent)
        
        mock_child_stat = mock_child.stat.return_value
        mock_child_stat.st_uid = 1000
        mock_child_stat.st_mode = 0o700
        mock_parent_stat = mock_parent.stat.return_value
        mock_parent_stat.st_uid = 1001
        
        update_dir_permissions_recursive(mock_child, 0o755)
        
        mock_child.chmod.assert_called_once_with(0o755)
        mock_parent.chmod.assert_not_called()

    @patch('os.getuid')
    def test_two_directories_child_not_owned(self, mock_getuid):
        # Test child not owned: no changes and no recursion to parent
        mock_getuid.return_value = 1000
        mock_child = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        mock_parent = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        type(mock_child).parent = PropertyMock(return_value=mock_parent)
        
        mock_child_stat = mock_child.stat.return_value
        mock_child_stat.st_uid = 1001
        
        update_dir_permissions_recursive(mock_child, 0o755)
        
        mock_child.chmod.assert_not_called()
        mock_parent.chmod.assert_not_called()

    @patch('os.getuid')
    @patch('builtins.print')
    def test_permission_error_in_child_then_parent_not_processed(self, mock_print, mock_getuid):
        # Test PermissionError in child: prints error and skips parent recursion
        mock_getuid.return_value = 1000
        mock_child = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        mock_parent = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        type(mock_child).parent = PropertyMock(return_value=mock_parent)
        
        mock_child_stat = mock_child.stat.return_value
        mock_child_stat.st_uid = 1000
        mock_child_stat.st_mode = 0o700
        mock_child.chmod.side_effect = PermissionError("Operation not permitted")
        
        update_dir_permissions_recursive(mock_child, 0o755)
        
        mock_child.chmod.assert_called_once_with(0o755)
        mock_print.assert_called_once()
        mock_parent.chmod.assert_not_called()

import unittest
import os
from pathlib import Path
import tempfile
from unittest.mock import patch, MagicMock

class TestDeleteUserFiles(unittest.TestCase):

    def test_single_file_deletion(self):
        # Test deletion of a single owned file in the top directory
        with tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as temp_dir:
            temp_dir = Path(temp_dir)
            file_path = temp_dir / 'test.txt'
            file_path.touch()
            self.assertTrue(file_path.exists())
            delete_user_files(temp_dir)
            self.assertFalse(file_path.exists())

    def test_nested_file_deletion(self):
        # Test deletion of owned files in nested directories
        with tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as temp_dir:
            temp_dir = Path(temp_dir)
            subdir = temp_dir / 'subdir'
            subdir.mkdir()
            file_path = subdir / 'test.txt'
            file_path.touch()
            delete_user_files(temp_dir)
            self.assertFalse(file_path.exists())
            self.assertTrue(subdir.exists())

    def test_non_owned_file_not_deleted(self):
        # Test that a file not owned by the current user is not deleted
        mock_file = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        mock_file.is_file.return_value = True
        mock_stat = MagicMock()
        mock_stat.st_uid = os.getuid() + 1
        mock_file.stat.return_value = mock_stat
        
        mock_directory = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        mock_directory.rglob.return_value = [mock_file]
        
        delete_user_files(mock_directory)
        mock_file.unlink.assert_not_called()

    @patch('builtins.print')
    def test_permission_error_handling(self, mock_print):
        # Test that PermissionError is caught and printed
        mock_file = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        mock_file.is_file.return_value = True
        mock_stat = MagicMock()
        mock_stat.st_uid = os.getuid()
        mock_file.stat.return_value = mock_stat
        mock_file.unlink.side_effect = PermissionError('Permission denied')
        mock_file.__str__.return_value = '/mock/file.txt'
        
        mock_directory = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        mock_directory.rglob.return_value = [mock_file]
        
        delete_user_files(mock_directory)
        mock_print.assert_called_once_with('Failed to delete /mock/file.txt: Permission denied')

    def test_passing_file_as_directory(self):
        # Test passing a file path as directory (should do nothing)
        with tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as temp_dir:
            temp_dir = Path(temp_dir)
            file_path = temp_dir / 'test.txt'
            file_path.touch()
            delete_user_files(file_path)
            self.assertTrue(file_path.exists())

    def test_non_existent_directory(self):
        # Test passing a non-existent directory (should do nothing)
        non_existent_dir = Path('/non_existent_dir_123456789')
        delete_user_files(non_existent_dir)

    def test_empty_directory(self):
        # Test empty directory (no files to delete)
        with tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as temp_dir:
            temp_dir = Path(temp_dir)
            delete_user_files(temp_dir)
            self.assertTrue(temp_dir.exists())

if __name__ == '__main__':
    unittest.main()

import unittest
import os
import time
from pathlib import Path
from unittest.mock import patch, MagicMock
import tempfile

# We assume the function delete_old_files is available

class TestDeleteOldFiles(unittest.TestCase):

    def test_case_1(self):
        # Happy path: two old files (deleted), one new (kept).
        with tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as temp_dir:
            temp_path = Path(temp_dir)
            with patch('time.time', return_value=1000000000.0):
                days_old = 5
                file1 = temp_path / 'file1.txt'
                file1.touch()
                os.utime(file1, (999567999, 999567999))
                file2 = temp_path / 'file2.txt'
                file2.touch()
                os.utime(file2, (999567998, 999567998))
                file3 = temp_path / 'file3.txt'
                file3.touch()
                os.utime(file3, (1000000000, 1000000000))
                
                delete_old_files(temp_path, days_old)
                
                self.assertFalse(file1.exists())
                self.assertFalse(file2.exists())
                self.assertTrue(file3.exists())
    
    def test_case_2(self):
        # Skip files not owned by current user.
        with tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as temp_dir:
            temp_path = Path(temp_dir)
            file1 = temp_path / 'file1.txt'
            file1.touch()
            old_time = time.time() - (100 * 86400)
            os.utime(file1, (old_time, old_time))
            
            mock_stat = MagicMock()
            mock_stat.st_uid = 1001
            mock_stat.st_mtime = old_time
            
            with patch('os.getuid', return_value=1000), patch.object(file1, 'stat', return_value=mock_stat):
                delete_old_files(temp_path, 1)
                
            self.assertTrue(file1.exists())
    
    def test_case_3(self):
        # Skip directories even if old and owned by current user.
        with tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as temp_dir:
            temp_path = Path(temp_dir)
            subdir = temp_path / 'subdir'
            subdir.mkdir()
            old_time = time.time() - (100 * 86400)
            os.utime(subdir, (old_time, old_time))
            
            delete_old_files(temp_path, 1)
            
            self.assertTrue(subdir.exists())
    
    def test_case_4(self):
        # Handle PermissionError by printing message.
        with tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as temp_dir:
            temp_path = Path(temp_dir)
            file1 = temp_path / 'file1.txt'
            file1.touch()
            old_time = time.time() - (100 * 86400)
            os.utime(file1, (old_time, old_time))
            
            with patch.object(file1, 'unlink', side_effect=PermissionError('Permission denied')), \
                 patch('builtins.print') as mock_print:
                delete_old_files(temp_path, 1)
                mock_print.assert_called_once_with(f'Failed to delete {file1}: Permission denied')
    
    def test_case_5(self):
        # Non-existent directory raises FileNotFoundError.
        with tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as temp_dir:
            temp_path = Path(temp_dir)
            os.rmdir(temp_path)
            with self.assertRaises(FileNotFoundError):
                delete_old_files(temp_path, 1)
    
    def test_case_6(self):
        # Negative days_old: file modified now is deleted (cutoff in future).
        with tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as temp_dir:
            temp_path = Path(temp_dir)
            with patch('time.time', return_value=1000000000.0):
                file1 = temp_path / 'file1.txt'
                file1.touch()
                os.utime(file1, (1000000000.0, 1000000000.0))
                
                delete_old_files(temp_path, -1)
                
                self.assertFalse(file1.exists())
    
    def test_case_7(self):
        # Zero days_old: file modified 1 second ago deleted, file at current time kept.
        with tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as temp_dir:
            temp_path = Path(temp_dir)
            with patch('time.time', return_value=1000000000.0):
                file1 = temp_path / 'file1.txt'
                file1.touch()
                os.utime(file1, (999999999, 999999999))
                file2 = temp_path / 'file2.txt'
                file2.touch()
                os.utime(file2, (1000000000, 1000000000))
                
                delete_old_files(temp_path, 0)
                
                self.assertFalse(file1.exists())
                self.assertTrue(file2.exists())
    
    def test_case_8(self):
        # File with mtime exactly at cutoff is not deleted.
        with tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as temp_dir:
            temp_path = Path(temp_dir)
            with patch('time.time', return_value=1000000000.0):
                days_old = 5
                cutoff = 1000000000 - days_old * 86400
                file1 = temp_path / 'file1.txt'
                file1.touch()
                os.utime(file1, (cutoff, cutoff))
                
                delete_old_files(temp_path, days_old)
                
                self.assertTrue(file1.exists())

if __name__ == '__main__':
    unittest.main()

import unittest
from unittest.mock import patch, MagicMock
import os

class TestSetFilePermissions(unittest.TestCase):
    @patch('os.getuid')
    def test_current_user_owner_success(self, mock_getuid):
        # Test setting permissions when current user is owner (happy path)
        mock_getuid.return_value = 1000
        mock_file_path = MagicMock()
        mock_file_path.stat.return_value.st_uid = 1000
        result = set_file_permissions(mock_file_path, 0o644)
        mock_file_path.chmod.assert_called_once_with(0o644)
        self.assertIsNone(result)

    @patch('os.getuid')
    def test_current_user_not_owner(self, mock_getuid):
        # Test no action when current user is not owner
        mock_getuid.return_value = 1000
        mock_file_path = MagicMock()
        mock_file_path.stat.return_value.st_uid = 1001
        result = set_file_permissions(mock_file_path, 0o644)
        mock_file_path.chmod.assert_not_called()
        self.assertIsNone(result)

    @patch('os.getuid')
    @patch('builtins.print')
    def test_current_user_owner_permission_error(self, mock_print, mock_getuid):
        # Test PermissionError handling during chmod
        mock_getuid.return_value = 1000
        mock_file_path = MagicMock()
        mock_file_path.__str__.return_value = '/path/to/file'
        mock_file_path.stat.return_value.st_uid = 1000
        mock_file_path.chmod.side_effect = PermissionError('Permission denied')
        result = set_file_permissions(mock_file_path, 0o644)
        mock_file_path.chmod.assert_called_once_with(0o644)
        mock_print.assert_called_once_with('Failed to change /path/to/file permission to 420: Permission denied')
        self.assertIsNone(result)

    def test_file_not_found(self):
        # Test FileNotFoundError from stat()
        mock_file_path = MagicMock()
        mock_file_path.stat.side_effect = FileNotFoundError('File not found')
        with self.assertRaises(FileNotFoundError):
            set_file_permissions(mock_file_path, 0o644)

    @patch('os.getuid')
    def test_non_integer_permissions(self, mock_getuid):
        # Test TypeError with non-integer permissions
        mock_getuid.return_value = 1000
        mock_file_path = MagicMock()
        mock_file_path.stat.return_value.st_uid = 1000
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            set_file_permissions(mock_file_path, '0o644')

import unittest
import os
import shutil
import tempfile
from pathlib import Path
from unittest.mock import patch, MagicMock

class TestSecureCopyFiles(unittest.TestCase):

    def test_target_owned_one_file(self):
        # Test copying a single file to a target directory owned by current user
        with tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as src_dir, tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as tgt_dir:
            src_path = Path(src_dir)
            tgt_path = Path(tgt_dir)
            
            # Create a test file in source
            test_file = src_path / "test1.txt"
            test_file.touch()
            
            # Call the function
            secure_copy_files(src_path, tgt_path)
            
            # Verify file was copied
            self.assertTrue((tgt_path / "test1.txt").exists())

    def test_target_owned_multiple_files(self):
        # Test copying multiple files to a target directory owned by current user
        with tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as src_dir, tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as tgt_dir:
            src_path = Path(src_dir)
            tgt_path = Path(tgt_dir)
            
            # Create multiple test files
            files = ["file1.txt", "file2.txt", "file3.txt"]
            for f in files:
                (src_path / f).touch()
            
            secure_copy_files(src_path, tgt_path)
            
            # Verify all files were copied
            for f in files:
                self.assertTrue((tgt_path / f).exists())

    def test_target_owned_empty_source(self):
        # Test with an empty source directory (should do nothing without errors)
        with tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as src_dir, tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as tgt_dir:
            src_path = Path(src_dir)
            tgt_path = Path(tgt_dir)
            
            # Ensure source is empty
            self.assertEqual(len(list(src_path.iterdir())), 0)
            
            secure_copy_files(src_path, tgt_path)
            
            # Target should remain empty
            self.assertEqual(len(list(tgt_path.iterdir())), 0)

    def test_target_not_owned(self):
        # Test when target directory is not owned by current user
        with tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as src_dir, tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as tgt_dir:
            src_path = Path(src_dir)
            tgt_path = Path(tgt_dir)
            
            # Create a test file
            (src_path / "test.txt").touch()
            
            # Mock ownership check
            mock_stat = MagicMock()
            mock_stat.st_uid = 1234  # Different from current user
            
            with patch.object(tgt_path, 'stat', return_value=mock_stat), \
                 patch('builtins.print') as mock_print, \
                 patch('shutil.copy') as mock_copy:
                
                secure_copy_files(src_path, tgt_path)
                
                # Verify print message and no copy attempted
                mock_print.assert_called_once_with(f"Target directory {tgt_path} is not owned by the current user.")
                mock_copy.assert_not_called()

    def test_permission_error_during_copy(self):
        # Test PermissionError during file copy operation
        with tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as src_dir, tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as tgt_dir:
            src_path = Path(src_dir)
            tgt_path = Path(tgt_dir)
            
            # Create two test files
            file1 = src_path / "file1.txt"
            file2 = src_path / "file2.txt"
            file1.touch()
            file2.touch()
            
            # Mock shutil.copy to raise PermissionError on first file
            with patch('shutil.copy') as mock_copy, \
                 patch('builtins.print') as mock_print:
                
                mock_copy.side_effect = PermissionError("Permission denied")
                secure_copy_files(src_path, tgt_path)
                
                # Verify error was printed and only one copy attempted
                mock_print.assert_called_once_with(f"Failed to copy {file1} to {tgt_path}: Permission denied")
                self.assertEqual(mock_copy.call_count, 1)
                
                # Verify no files were copied
                self.assertEqual(len(list(tgt_path.iterdir())), 0)

    def test_source_not_exist(self):
        # Test when source directory does not exist
        with tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as base_dir:
            src_path = Path(base_dir) / "non_existent_source"
            tgt_path = Path(base_dir) / "target"
            tgt_path.mkdir()
            
            with self.assertRaises(FileNotFoundError):
                secure_copy_files(src_path, tgt_path)

    def test_target_not_exist(self):
        # Test when target directory does not exist
        with tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as base_dir:
            src_path = Path(base_dir) / "source"
            src_path.mkdir()
            tgt_path = Path(base_dir) / "non_existent_target"
            
            with self.assertRaises(FileNotFoundError):
                secure_copy_files(src_path, tgt_path)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    unittest.main()

import unittest
import os
from pathlib import Path
from unittest.mock import MagicMock, patch

class TestChangeDirectoryPermissionsUp(unittest.TestCase):

    @patch('os.getuid')
    def test_happy_path(self, mock_getuid):
        # Test changing permissions for a chain of three owned directories
        mock_getuid.return_value = 1000
        
        leaf = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        middle = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        root = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        
        leaf.parent = middle
        middle.parent = root
        root.parent = root  # Root's parent is itself
        
        leaf_stat = MagicMock()
        leaf_stat.st_uid = 1000
        leaf_stat.st_mode = 0o700
        leaf.stat.return_value = leaf_stat
        
        middle_stat = MagicMock()
        middle_stat.st_uid = 1000
        middle_stat.st_mode = 0o700
        middle.stat.return_value = middle_stat
        
        root_stat = MagicMock()
        root_stat.st_uid = 1000
        root_stat.st_mode = 0o700
        root.stat.return_value = root_stat
        
        change_directory_permissions_up(leaf, 0o755)
        
        leaf.chmod.assert_called_once_with(0o755)
        middle.chmod.assert_called_once_with(0o755)
        root.chmod.assert_called_once_with(0o755)

    @patch('os.getuid')
    def test_non_owned_in_middle(self, mock_getuid):
        # Test stopping at non-owned directory in the middle
        mock_getuid.return_value = 1000
        
        leaf = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        middle = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        
        leaf.parent = middle
        middle.parent = MagicMock(spec=Path)  # Not accessed in test
        
        leaf_stat = MagicMock()
        leaf_stat.st_uid = 1000
        leaf_stat.st_mode = 0o700
        leaf.stat.return_value = leaf_stat
        
        middle_stat = MagicMock()
        middle_stat.st_uid = 1001  # Not owned
        middle.stat.return_value = middle_stat
        
        change_directory_permissions_up(leaf, 0o755)
        
        leaf.chmod.assert_called_once_with(0o755)
        middle.chmod.assert_not_called()
        middle.parent.stat.assert_not_called()

    @patch('os.getuid')
    def test_root_directory(self, mock_getuid):
        # Test root directory (parent equals itself)
        mock_getuid.return_value = 1000
        
        root = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        root.parent = root
        
        root_stat = MagicMock()
        root_stat.st_uid = 1000
        root_stat.st_mode = 0o700
        root.stat.return_value = root_stat
        
        change_directory_permissions_up(root, 0o755)
        
        root.chmod.assert_called_once_with(0o755)

    @patch('os.getuid')
    def test_permissions_already_set(self, mock_getuid):
        # Test directories where permissions are already set
        mock_getuid.return_value = 1000
        
        leaf = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        middle = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        root = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        
        leaf.parent = middle
        middle.parent = root
        root.parent = root
        
        leaf_stat = MagicMock()
        leaf_stat.st_uid = 1000
        leaf_stat.st_mode = 0o755  # Already set
        leaf.stat.return_value = leaf_stat
        
        middle_stat = MagicMock()
        middle_stat.st_uid = 1000
        middle_stat.st_mode = 0o700  # Not set
        middle.stat.return_value = middle_stat
        
        root_stat = MagicMock()
        root_stat.st_uid = 1000
        root_stat.st_mode = 0o755  # Already set
        root.stat.return_value = root_stat
        
        change_directory_permissions_up(leaf, 0o755)
        
        leaf.chmod.assert_not_called()
        middle.chmod.assert_called_once_with(0o755)
        root.chmod.assert_not_called()

    @patch('os.getuid')
    @patch('builtins.print')
    def test_permission_error(self, mock_print, mock_getuid):
        # Test handling PermissionError for an owned directory
        mock_getuid.return_value = 1000
        
        leaf = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        leaf.parent = MagicMock(spec=Path)  # Not accessed
        
        leaf_stat = MagicMock()
        leaf_stat.st_uid = 1000
        leaf_stat.st_mode = 0o700
        leaf.stat.return_value = leaf_stat
        
        leaf.chmod.side_effect = PermissionError('Operation not permitted')
        
        change_directory_permissions_up(leaf, 0o755)
        
        leaf.chmod.assert_called_once_with(0o755)
        mock_print.assert_called_once_with(f'Failed to change {leaf} permission to 0o755: Operation not permitted')
        leaf.parent.stat.assert_not_called()

    @patch('os.getuid')
    def test_nonexistent_directory(self, mock_getuid):
        # Test non-existent directory (raises FileNotFoundError)
        mock_getuid.return_value = 1000
        
        directory = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        directory.stat.side_effect = FileNotFoundError
        
        with self.assertRaises(FileNotFoundError):
            change_directory_permissions_up(directory, 0o755)

    @patch('os.getuid')
    def test_starting_directory_not_owned(self, mock_getuid):
        # Test starting with a non-owned directory (no changes)
        mock_getuid.return_value = 1000
        
        leaf = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        leaf.parent = MagicMock(spec=Path)
        
        leaf_stat = MagicMock()
        leaf_stat.st_uid = 1001  # Not owned
        leaf.stat.return_value = leaf_stat
        
        change_directory_permissions_up(leaf, 0o755)
        
        leaf.chmod.assert_not_called()
        leaf.parent.stat.assert_not_called()

if __name__ == '__main__':
    unittest.main()

import unittest
from unittest.mock import patch, ANY, MagicMock

from unittest.mock import patch, MagicMock, ANY
import smtplib
import ssl

class TestEmailViaTLS(unittest.TestCase):

    @patch('smtplib.SMTP')

        email_via_tls('smtp.example.com', 587, 'sender@test.com', 'recipient@test.com', 'pass123', 'Test message')
        mock_smtp.assert_called_once_with('smtp.example.com', 587)

import unittest
import smtplib
import ssl
from email.message import EmailMessage
from unittest.mock import patch

class TestSecureTlsEmail(unittest.TestCase):

    def test_successful_send(self):
        # Test successful email sending with valid parameters
        with patch('smtplib.SMTP') as mock_smtp, \
             patch('ssl.create_default_context') as mock_context, \
             patch('builtins.print') as mock_print:
            mock_server = mock_smtp.return_value
            secure_tls_email('smtp.example.com', 587, 'sender@test.com', 'recipient@test.com', 'pass123', 'Test content')
            mock_smtp.assert_called_once_with('smtp.example.com', 587)
            mock_server.starttls.assert_called_once_with(context=mock_context.return_value)
            mock_server.login.assert_called_once_with('sender@test.com', 'pass123')
            mock_server.send_message.assert_called_once()
            sent_email = mock_server.send_message.call_args[0][0]
            self.assertEqual(sent_email['Subject'], 'Test Email')
            self.assertEqual(sent_email['From'], 'sender@test.com')
            self.assertEqual(sent_email['To'], 'recipient@test.com')
            self.assertEqual(sent_email.get_content(), 'Test content')
            mock_server.quit.assert_called_once()
            mock_print.assert_called_once_with('Email sent successfully')

    def test_authentication_failure(self):
        # Test invalid credentials raising SMTPAuthenticationError
        with patch('smtplib.SMTP') as mock_smtp, \
             patch('ssl.create_default_context') as mock_context:
            mock_server = mock_smtp.return_value
            mock_server.login.side_effect = smtplib.SMTPAuthenticationError(535, b'Bad credentials')
            with self.assertRaises(smtplib.SMTPAuthenticationError) as context:
                secure_tls_email('smtp.example.com', 587, 'user@test.com', 'to@test.com', 'wrongpass', 'Content')
            self.assertIn('Authentication failed', str(context.exception))
            mock_server.login.assert_called_once_with('user@test.com', 'wrongpass')
            mock_server.quit.assert_called_once()

    def test_ssl_error(self):
        # Test SSL certificate failure raising SSLError
        with patch('smtplib.SMTP') as mock_smtp, \
             patch('ssl.create_default_context') as mock_context:
            mock_server = mock_smtp.return_value
            mock_server.starttls.side_effect = ssl.SSLError("Certificate verify failed")
            with self.assertRaises(ssl.SSLError) as context:
                secure_tls_email('invalid.host', 587, 'user@test.com', 'to@test.com', 'pass', 'Content')
            self.assertIn('SSL error', str(context.exception))
            mock_server.starttls.assert_called_once_with(context=mock_context.return_value)
            mock_server.quit.assert_called_once()
            mock_server.login.assert_not_called()

    def test_smtp_exception_during_login(self):
        # Test SMTPException during login
        with patch('smtplib.SMTP') as mock_smtp, \
             patch('ssl.create_default_context') as mock_context:
            mock_server = mock_smtp.return_value
            mock_server.login.side_effect = smtplib.SMTPException("Login error")
            with self.assertRaises(smtplib.SMTPException) as context:
                secure_tls_email('smtp.example.com', 587, 'user@test.com', 'to@test.com', 'pass', 'Content')
            self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "SMTP error occurred: Login error")
            mock_server.login.assert_called_once()
            mock_server.quit.assert_called_once()

    def test_smtp_exception_during_send(self):
        # Test SMTPException during message sending
        with patch('smtplib.SMTP') as mock_smtp, \
             patch('ssl.create_default_context') as mock_context:
            mock_server = mock_smtp.return_value
            mock_server.send_message.side_effect = smtplib.SMTPException("Send error")
            with self.assertRaises(smtplib.SMTPException) as context:
                secure_tls_email('smtp.example.com', 587, 'user@test.com', 'to@test.com', 'pass', 'Content')
            self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), "SMTP error occurred: Send error")
            mock_server.send_message.assert_called_once()
            mock_server.quit.assert_called_once()

    def test_empty_content(self):
        # Test sending email with empty content
        with patch('smtplib.SMTP') as mock_smtp, \
             patch('ssl.create_default_context') as mock_context, \
             patch('builtins.print') as mock_print:
            mock_server = mock_smtp.return_value
            secure_tls_email('smtp.example.com', 587, 'sender@test.com', 'recipient@test.com', 'pass123', '')
            sent_email = mock_server.send_message.call_args[0][0]
            self.assertEqual(sent_email.get_content(), '')
            mock_server.quit.assert_called_once()
            mock_print.assert_called_once_with('Email sent successfully')

    def test_long_content(self):
        # Test sending email with very long content
        long_content = 'A' * 10000
        with patch('smtplib.SMTP') as mock_smtp, \
             patch('ssl.create_default_context') as mock_context, \
             patch('builtins.print') as mock_print:
            mock_server = mock_smtp.return_value
            secure_tls_email('smtp.example.com', 587, 'sender@test.com', 'recipient@test.com', 'pass123', long_content)
            sent_email = mock_server.send_message.call_args[0][0]
            self.assertEqual(sent_email.get_content(), long_content)
            mock_server.quit.assert_called_once()
            mock_print.assert_called_once_with('Email sent successfully')

    def test_non_string_inputs(self):
        # Test non-string inputs raising appropriate exceptions
        with self.assertRaises((TypeError, AttributeError)):
            secure_tls_email(123, 587, 'sender@test.com', 'recipient@test.com', 'pass', 'Content')
        with self.assertRaises((TypeError, AttributeError)):
            secure_tls_email('smtp.example.com', '587', 'sender@test.com', 'recipient@test.com', 'pass', 'Content')
        with self.assertRaises((TypeError, AttributeError)):
            secure_tls_email('smtp.example.com', 587, 123, 'recipient@test.com', 'pass', 'Content')
        with self.assertRaises((TypeError, AttributeError)):
            secure_tls_email('smtp.example.com', 587, 'sender@test.com', 123, 'pass', 'Content')
        with self.assertRaises((TypeError, AttributeError)):
            secure_tls_email('smtp.example.com', 587, 'sender@test.com', 'recipient@test.com', 123, 'Content')
        with self.assertRaises((TypeError, AttributeError)):
            secure_tls_email('smtp.example.com', 587, 'sender@test.com', 'recipient@test.com', 'pass', 123)

    def test_invalid_port(self):
        # Test invalid port numbers
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError):
            secure_tls_email('smtp.example.com', -1, 'a@test.com', 'b@test.com', 'pass', 'Content')
        with self.assertRaises(ValueError):
            secure_tls_email('smtp.example.com', 0, 'a@test.com', 'b@test.com', 'pass', 'Content')
        with self.assertRaises(OverflowError):
            secure_tls_email('smtp.example.com', 70000, 'a@test.com', 'b@test.com', 'pass', 'Content')

    def test_empty_credentials(self):
        # Test empty email credentials
        with patch('smtplib.SMTP') as mock_smtp, \
             patch('ssl.create_default_context') as mock_context:
            mock_server = mock_smtp.return_value
            with self.assertRaises(smtplib.SMTPAuthenticationError):
                secure_tls_email('smtp.example.com', 587, '', 'to@test.com', '', 'Content')
            mock_server.quit.assert_called_once()

import unittest
from unittest.mock import patch, MagicMock
import smtplib
import ssl

class TestTlsSecureEmail(unittest.TestCase):

    def test_happy_path(self):
        """Test successful email sending with valid parameters."""
        with patch('smtplib.SMTP') as mock_smtp:
            mock_server = mock_smtp.return_value
            mail_server = 'smtp.example.com'
            mail_port = 587
            email_from = 'sender@example.com'
            email_to = 'receiver@example.com'
            auth_pass = 'secure_password'
            content = 'This is a test email content.'
            
            tls_secure_email(mail_server, mail_port, email_from, email_to, auth_pass, content)
            
            mock_smtp.assert_called_once_with(mail_server, mail_port)
            mock_server.starttls.assert_called_once_with(context=unittest.mock.ANY)
            mock_server.login.assert_called_once_with(email_from, auth_pass)
            
            # Verify email content and headers
            sent_email = mock_server.send_message.call_args[0][0]
            self.assertEqual(sent_email['Subject'], 'Test Email')
            self.assertEqual(sent_email['From'], email_from)
            self.assertEqual(sent_email['To'], email_to)
            self.assertEqual(sent_email.get_content(), content)
            mock_server.quit.assert_called_once()

    def test_authentication_failure(self):
        """Test invalid credentials raising SMTPAuthenticationError."""
        with patch('smtplib.SMTP') as mock_smtp:
            mock_server = mock_smtp.return_value
            mock_server.login.side_effect = smtplib.SMTPAuthenticationError(535, b'Invalid credentials')
            
            with self.assertRaises(smtplib.SMTPAuthenticationError) as context:
                tls_secure_email('smtp.example.com', 587, 'user', 'recipient', 'wrongpass', 'content')
            
            self.assertIn('Authentication failed', str(context.exception))
            mock_server.quit.assert_called_once()

    def test_ssl_error_during_starttls(self):
        """Test SSL error during STARTTLS raising SSLError."""
        with patch('smtplib.SMTP') as mock_smtp:
            mock_server = mock_smtp.return_value
            mock_server.starttls.side_effect = ssl.SSLError('SSL handshake failed')
            
            with self.assertRaises(ssl.SSLError) as context:
                tls_secure_email('smtp.example.com', 587, 'user', 'recipient', 'pass', 'content')
            
            self.assertEqual(str(context.exception), 'SSL handshake failed')
            mock_server.quit.assert_called_once()

    def test_ssl_error_during_login(self):
        """Test SSL error during login raising wrapped SSLError."""
        with patch('smtplib.SMTP') as mock_smtp:
            mock_server = mock_smtp.return_value
            mock_server.login.side_effect = ssl.SSLError('Certificate validation failed')
            
            with self.assertRaises(ssl.SSLError) as context:
                tls_secure_email('smtp.example.com', 587, 'user', 'recipient', 'pass', 'content')
            
            self.assertIn('SSL error: Certificate validation failed', str(context.exception))
            mock_server.quit.assert_called_once()

    def test_smtp_exception_during_send(self):
        """Test general SMTP exception during send_message."""
        with patch('smtplib.SMTP') as mock_smtp:
            mock_server = mock_smtp.return_value
            mock_server.send_message.side_effect = smtplib.SMTPException('Server rejected message')
            
            with self.assertRaises(smtplib.SMTPException) as context:
                tls_secure_email('smtp.example.com', 587, 'user', 'recipient', 'pass', 'content')
            
            self.assertIn('SMTP error occurred: Server rejected message', str(context.exception))
            mock_server.quit.assert_called_once()

    def test_empty_content(self):
        """Test sending email with empty content."""
        with patch('smtplib.SMTP') as mock_smtp:
            mock_server = mock_smtp.return_value
            content = ''
            
            tls_secure_email('smtp.example.com', 587, 'sender', 'recipient', 'pass', content)
            
            sent_email = mock_server.send_message.call_args[0][0]
            self.assertEqual(sent_email.get_content(), content)
            mock_server.quit.assert_called_once()

    def test_none_content(self):
        """Test None content raising TypeError."""
        with patch('smtplib.SMTP') as mock_smtp:
            mock_server = mock_smtp.return_value
            
            with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
                tls_secure_email('smtp.example.com', 587, 'sender', 'recipient', 'pass', None)
            
            mock_server.quit.assert_called_once()

    def test_empty_credentials_and_recipient(self):
        """Test with empty sender, recipient, and password."""
        with patch('smtplib.SMTP') as mock_smtp:
            mock_server = mock_smtp.return_value
            email_from = ''
            email_to = ''
            auth_pass = ''
            content = 'Content'
            
            tls_secure_email('smtp.example.com', 587, email_from, email_to, auth_pass, content)
            
            mock_server.login.assert_called_once_with('', '')
            sent_email = mock_server.send_message.call_args[0][0]
            self.assertEqual(sent_email['From'], '')
            self.assertEqual(sent_email['To'], '')
            mock_server.quit.assert_called_once()

import unittest
from unittest.mock import patch, MagicMock
import smtplib
import ssl
from email.message import EmailMessage

class TestTlsEmailSend(unittest.TestCase):

    def test_successful_email_sending(self):
        """Test sending an email with valid parameters and verify correct operations."""
        mock_server = MagicMock()
        with patch('smtplib.SMTP', return_value=mock_server) as mock_smtp, \
             patch('builtins.print') as mock_print:
            
            tls_email_send('smtp.example.com', 587, 'user@example.com', 'recipient@example.com', 'password', 'Test email body')
            
            mock_smtp.assert_called_once_with('smtp.example.com', 587)
            mock_server.starttls.assert_called_once()
            context_arg = mock_server.starttls.call_args[1]['context']
            self.assertIsInstance(context_arg, ssl.SSLContext)
            mock_server.login.assert_called_once_with('user@example.com', 'password')
            
            # Verify email content
            self.assertEqual(mock_server.send_message.call_count, 1)
            sent_email = mock_server.send_message.call_args[0][0]
            self.assertEqual(sent_email['Subject'], 'Test Email')
            self.assertEqual(sent_email['From'], 'user@example.com')
            self.assertEqual(sent_email['To'], 'recipient@example.com')
            self.assertEqual(sent_email.get_content(), 'Test email body')
            
            mock_print.assert_called_once_with("Email sent successfully")
            mock_server.quit.assert_called_once()

    def test_authentication_failure(self):
        """Test authentication failure raises SMTPAuthenticationError and quits server."""
        mock_server = MagicMock()
        mock_server.login.side_effect = smtplib.SMTPAuthenticationError(535, b'Invalid credentials')
        
        with patch('smtplib.SMTP', return_value=mock_server):
            with self.assertRaises(smtplib.SMTPAuthenticationError):
                tls_email_send('host', 587, 'user', 'recipient', 'wrongpass', 'body')
            
            mock_server.quit.assert_called_once()

    def test_ssl_error_during_starttls(self):
        """Test SSL error during STARTTLS raises SSLError and doesn't call quit."""
        mock_server = MagicMock()
        mock_server.starttls.side_effect = ssl.SSLError("SSL handshake failed")
        
        with patch('smtplib.SMTP', return_value=mock_server):
            with self.assertRaises(ssl.SSLError):
                tls_email_send('host', 587, 'user', 'recipient', 'pass', 'body')
            
            mock_server.quit.assert_not_called()

    def test_ssl_error_during_login(self):
        """Test SSL error during login raises SSLError and quits server."""
        mock_server = MagicMock()
        mock_server.login.side_effect = ssl.SSLError("SSL error during login")
        
        with patch('smtplib.SMTP', return_value=mock_server):
            with self.assertRaises(ssl.SSLError):
                tls_email_send('host', 587, 'user', 'recipient', 'pass', 'body')
            
            mock_server.quit.assert_called_once()

    def test_smtp_exception_during_send(self):
        """Test SMTPException during sending raises exception and quits server."""
        mock_server = MagicMock()
        mock_server.send_message.side_effect = smtplib.SMTPException("Send failed")
        
        with patch('smtplib.SMTP', return_value=mock_server):
            with self.assertRaises(smtplib.SMTPException):
                tls_email_send('host', 587, 'user', 'recipient', 'pass', 'body')
            
            mock_server.login.assert_called_once()
            mock_server.quit.assert_called_once()

    def test_other_smtp_exception_during_login(self):
        """Test non-auth SMTPException during login raises exception and quits server."""
        mock_server = MagicMock()
        mock_server.login.side_effect = smtplib.SMTPException("Server unavailable")
        
        with patch('smtplib.SMTP', return_value=mock_server):
            with self.assertRaises(smtplib.SMTPException):
                tls_email_send('host', 587, 'user', 'recipient', 'pass', 'body')
            
            mock_server.quit.assert_called_once()

import unittest
from unittest.mock import patch, MagicMock
import smtplib
import ssl
from email.message import EmailMessage

class TestCases(unittest.TestCase):

    @patch('ssl.create_default_context')
    @patch('smtplib.SMTP')
    def test_successful_email_send(self, mock_smtp, mock_create_context):
        # Test successful email sending with valid parameters
        mock_server = mock_smtp.return_value
        mock_context = mock_create_context.return_value
        
        host = "smtp.example.com"
        port = 587
        sender = "sender@example.com"
        recipient = "recipient@example.com"
        password = "password123"
        message_text = "This is a test email."
        
        with patch('builtins.print') as mock_print:
            smtp_tls_mail_send(host, port, sender, recipient, password, message_text)
            mock_print.assert_called_once_with("Email sent successfully")
        
        mock_smtp.assert_called_once_with(host, port)
        mock_server.starttls.assert_called_once_with(context=mock_context)
        mock_server.login.assert_called_once_with(sender, password)
        
        sent_email = mock_server.send_message.call_args[0][0]
        self.assertIsInstance(sent_email, EmailMessage)
        self.assertEqual(sent_email['Subject'], 'Test Email')
        self.assertEqual(sent_email['From'], sender)
        self.assertEqual(sent_email['To'], recipient)
        self.assertEqual(sent_email.get_content(), message_text)
        mock_server.quit.assert_called_once()

    @patch('smtplib.SMTP')
    def test_authentication_failure(self, mock_smtp):
        # Test authentication failure with invalid credentials
        mock_server = mock_smtp.return_value
        mock_server.login.side_effect = smtplib.SMTPAuthenticationError(535, b'Authentication failed')
        
        with self.assertRaises(smtplib.SMTPAuthenticationError):
            smtp_tls_mail_send("host", 587, "user", "recipient", "wrongpass", "text")
        
        mock_server.login.assert_called_once()
        mock_server.quit.assert_called_once()

    @patch('smtplib.SMTP')
    def test_ssl_error(self, mock_smtp):
        # Test SSL error during TLS handshake
        mock_server = mock_smtp.return_value
        mock_server.starttls.side_effect = ssl.SSLError("SSL handshake failed")
        
        with self.assertRaises(ssl.SSLError):
            smtp_tls_mail_send("host", 587, "user", "recipient", "pass", "text")
        
        mock_server.starttls.assert_called_once()
        mock_server.quit.assert_called_once()

    @patch('smtplib.SMTP')
    def test_smtp_exception_during_login(self, mock_smtp):
        # Test SMTP exception during login
        mock_server = mock_smtp.return_value
        mock_server.login.side_effect = smtplib.SMTPException("Login error")
        
        with self.assertRaises(smtplib.SMTPException):
            smtp_tls_mail_send("host", 587, "user", "recipient", "pass", "text")
        
        mock_server.login.assert_called_once()
        mock_server.quit.assert_called_once()

    @patch('smtplib.SMTP')
    def test_smtp_exception_during_send(self, mock_smtp):
        # Test SMTP exception during email sending
        mock_server = mock_smtp.return_value
        mock_server.send_message.side_effect = smtplib.SMTPException("Send error")
        
        with self.assertRaises(smtplib.SMTPException):
            smtp_tls_mail_send("host", 587, "user", "recipient", "pass", "text")
        
        mock_server.send_message.assert_called_once()
        mock_server.quit.assert_called_once()

    @patch('smtplib.SMTP')
    def test_server_quit_called_on_exception(self, mock_smtp):
        # Test server.quit() is called even when exception occurs
        mock_server = mock_smtp.return_value
        mock_server.login.side_effect = smtplib.SMTPException("Any error")
        
        with self.assertRaises(smtplib.SMTPException):
            smtp_tls_mail_send("host", 587, "user", "recipient", "pass", "text")
        
        mock_server.quit.assert_called_once()

    @patch('smtplib.SMTP')
    def test_empty_email_content(self, mock_smtp):
        # Test sending email with empty content
        mock_server = mock_smtp.return_value
        message_text = ""
        
        smtp_tls_mail_send("host", 587, "sender", "recipient", "pass", message_text)
        
        sent_email = mock_server.send_message.call_args[0][0]
        self.assertEqual(sent_email.get_content(), message_text)

    def test_invalid_arguments(self):
        # Test invalid argument types
        with self.subTest("None mail_host"):
            with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
                smtp_tls_mail_send(None, 587, "user", "recipient", "pass", "text")
        
        with self.subTest("None port"):
            with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
                smtp_tls_mail_send("host", None, "user", "recipient", "pass", "text")
        
        with self.subTest("None user_email"):
            with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
                smtp_tls_mail_send("host", 587, None, "recipient", "pass", "text")
        
        with self.subTest("None recipient_id"):
            with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
                smtp_tls_mail_send("host", 587, "user", None, "pass", "text")
        
        with self.subTest("None login_password"):
            with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
                smtp_tls_mail_send("host", 587, "user", "recipient", None, "text")
        
        with self.subTest("None mail_text"):
            with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
                smtp_tls_mail_send("host", 587, "user", "recipient", "pass", None)
        
        with self.subTest("Port as string"):
            with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
                smtp_tls_mail_send("host", "587", "user", "recipient", "pass", "text")

    @patch('requests.get')
    def test_ssl_error(self, mock_get):
        # Test SSL certificate validation failure
        mock_get.side_effect = requests.exceptions.SSLError('SSL failure')
        with self.assertRaises(requests.exceptions.SSLError):
            secure_https_conn('https://invalid-ssl.com', 5)

    def test_timeout_error(self, mock_get):
        # Test request timeout
        mock_get.side_effect = requests.exceptions.Timeout('Timeout occurred')
        with self.assertRaises(requests.exceptions.RequestException):
            secure_https_conn('https://timeout.com', 1)

    @patch('requests.get')

        # Test connection error
        mock_get.side_effect = requests.exceptions.ConnectionError('Connection failed')
        with self.assertRaises(requests.exceptions.RequestException):
            secure_https_conn('https://unreachable.com', 5)

    @patch('requests.get')
    def test_http_error(self, mock_get):
        # Test non-200 HTTP status
        mock_response = MagicMock()
        mock_response.status_code = 404
        mock_response.raise_for_status.side_effect = requests.exceptions.HTTPError('404 Error')
        mock_get.return_value = mock_response
        with self.assertRaises(requests.exceptions.RequestException):
            secure_https_conn('https://notfound.com', 5)

    @patch('requests.get')
    def test_empty_endpoint(self, mock_get):
        # Test empty URL string
        mock_get.side_effect = requests.exceptions.MissingSchema('Invalid URL')
        with self.assertRaises(requests.exceptions.RequestException):
            secure_https_conn('', 5)

    def test_none_endpoint(self):
        # Test None URL
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            secure_https_conn(None, 5)

    def test_non_string_endpoint(self):
        # Test non-string URL
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            secure_https_conn(12345, 5)

    def test_non_number_delay(self):
        # Test non-numeric delay
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            secure_https_conn('https://valid.com', 'five')

    @patch('requests.get')
    def test_large_response(self, mock_get):
        # Test large response content
        large_content = 'A' * 100000
        mock_response = MagicMock()
        mock_response.status_code = 200
        mock_response.text = large_content
        mock_get.return_value = mock_response
        result = secure_https_conn('https://large-response.com', 5)
        self.assertEqual(result, large_content)

import unittest
from unittest.mock import patch, MagicMock
import paramiko
import ssl

class TestUploadSftpSecure(unittest.TestCase):

    @patch('paramiko.SSHClient')
    @patch('ssl.create_default_context')
    @patch('builtins.print')
    def test_upload_success(self, mock_print, mock_ssl_context, mock_ssh_client):
        """Test successful file upload with valid parameters."""
        mock_ssh = mock_ssh_client.return_value
        mock_sftp = mock_ssh.open_sftp.return_value
        mock_wrapped_socket = mock_ssl_context.return_value.wrap_socket.return_value
        
        server_address = "example.com"
        user = "test_user"
        passkey = "secure_password"
        source_file = "/local/path/file.txt"
        destination_file = "/remote/path/file.txt"
        
        # Execute function
        upload_sftp_secure(server_address, user, passkey, source_file, destination_file)
        
        # Verify SSL context and SSH setup
        mock_ssl_context.assert_called_once_with()
        mock_ssh.set_missing_host_key_policy.assert_called_once_with(paramiko.AutoAddPolicy())
        mock_ssl_context.return_value.wrap_socket.assert_called_once_with(
            mock_ssh.sock, server_hostname=server_address
        )
        mock_ssh.connect.assert_called_once_with(
            server_address,
            username=user,
            password=passkey,
            sock=mock_wrapped_socket
        )
        
        # Verify SFTP operations
        mock_ssh.open_sftp.assert_called_once()
        mock_sftp.put.assert_called_once_with(source_file, destination_file)
        mock_print.assert_called_once_with(f"File uploaded successfully to {destination_file}")
        
        # Verify cleanup
        mock_sftp.close.assert_called_once()
        mock_ssh.close.assert_called_once()

    @patch('paramiko.SSHClient')
    @patch('ssl.create_default_context')
    def test_ssh_connection_error(self, mock_ssl_context, mock_ssh_client):
        """Test SSHException during SSH connection setup."""
        mock_ssh = mock_ssh_client.return_value
        mock_ssh.connect.side_effect = paramiko.ssh_exception.SSHException("Connection failed")
        
        # Execute and verify exception
        with self.assertRaises(UnboundLocalError):
            upload_sftp_secure("invalid_server", "user", "pass", "src.txt", "dest.txt")
        
        # Verify cleanup not completed due to exception
        mock_ssh.close.assert_not_called()

    @patch('paramiko.SSHClient')
    @patch('ssl.create_default_context')
    def test_sftp_open_error(self, mock_ssl_context, mock_ssh_client):
        """Test SSHException when opening SFTP channel."""
        mock_ssh = mock_ssh_client.return_value
        mock_ssh.open_sftp.side_effect = paramiko.ssh_exception.SSHException("SFTP open failed")
        
        # Execute and verify exception
        with self.assertRaises(UnboundLocalError):
            upload_sftp_secure("example.com", "user", "pass", "src.txt", "dest.txt")
        
        # Verify cleanup not completed
        mock_ssh.close.assert_not_called()

    @patch('paramiko.SSHClient')
    @patch('ssl.create_default_context')
    def test_sftp_operation_error(self, mock_ssl_context, mock_ssh_client):
        """Test SFTPError during file upload operation."""
        mock_ssh = mock_ssh_client.return_value
        mock_sftp = mock_ssh.open_sftp.return_value
        mock_sftp.put.side_effect = paramiko.sftp.SFTPError("Permission denied")
        
        # Execute and verify exception
        with self.assertRaises(paramiko.sftp.SFTPError) as context:
            upload_sftp_secure("example.com", "user", "pass", "src.txt", "dest.txt")
        
        # Verify exception message
        self.assertIn("SFTP error: Permission denied", str(context.exception))
        
        # Verify cleanup
        mock_sftp.close.assert_called_once()
        mock_ssh.close.assert_called_once()

    @patch('paramiko.SSHClient')
    @patch('ssl.create_default_context')
    def test_io_error(self, mock_ssl_context, mock_ssh_client):
        """Test IOError when accessing local file."""
        mock_ssh = mock_ssh_client.return_value
        mock_sftp = mock_ssh.open_sftp.return_value
        mock_sftp.put.side_effect = IOError("File not found")
        
        # Execute and verify exception
        with self.assertRaises(IOError) as context:
            upload_sftp_secure("example.com", "user", "pass", "missing.txt", "dest.txt")
        
        # Verify exception message
        self.assertIn("File error: File not found", str(context.exception))
        
        # Verify cleanup
        mock_sftp.close.assert_called_once()
        mock_ssh.close.assert_called_once()

import unittest
from unittest.mock import patch, MagicMock
import paramiko
import ssl

class TestUploadSFTPSecurely(unittest.TestCase):

    @patch('ssl.create_default_context')
    @patch('paramiko.SSHClient')
    @patch('builtins.print')
    def test_happy_path(self, mock_print, mock_ssh_client, mock_ssl_ctx):
        # Test successful file upload with valid parameters
        server_address = 'sftp.example.com'
        user_id = 'user123'
        user_password = 'pass123'
        file_local = 'local.txt'
        file_remote = 'remote.txt'
        
        mock_ssh_instance = MagicMock()
        mock_sftp_instance = MagicMock()
        mock_ssl_context = MagicMock()
        mock_socket = MagicMock()
        
        mock_ssh_client.return_value = mock_ssh_instance
        mock_ssl_ctx.return_value = mock_ssl_context
        mock_ssl_context.wrap_socket.return_value = mock_socket
        mock_ssh_instance.open_sftp.return_value = mock_sftp_instance
        
        upload_sftp_securely(server_address, user_id, user_password, file_local, file_remote)
        
        mock_ssl_ctx.assert_called_once()
        mock_ssh_client.assert_called_once()
        mock_ssh_instance.set_missing_host_key_policy.assert_called_once_with(paramiko.AutoAddPolicy)
        mock_ssl_context.wrap_socket.assert_called_once_with(mock_ssh_instance.sock, server_hostname=server_address)
        mock_ssh_instance.connect.assert_called_once_with(
            server_address,
            username=user_id,
            password=user_password,
            sock=mock_socket
        )
        mock_ssh_instance.open_sftp.assert_called_once()
        mock_sftp_instance.put.assert_called_once_with(file_local, file_remote)
        mock_print.assert_called_once_with(f'File uploaded successfully to {file_remote}')
        mock_sftp_instance.close.assert_called_once()
        mock_ssh_instance.close.assert_called_once()

        with self.assertRaises(paramiko.ssh_exception.SSHException):
            upload_sftp_securely('sftp.example.com', 'user', 'pass', 'local.txt', 'remote.txt')
        
        mock_ssh_instance.close.assert_not_called()

        mock_ssh_client.return_value = mock_ssh_instance
        mock_ssl_ctx.return_value = mock_ssl_context
        mock_ssl_context.wrap_socket.return_value = mock_socket
        mock_ssh_instance.open_sftp.return_value = mock_sftp_instance
        
        mock_sftp_instance.put.side_effect = IOError('No such file')

        # Test invalid key format causing connection failure
